decks.notes: This combo deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider and Neoform to quickly summon Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant or Griselbrand onto the battlefield. Eldritch Evolution and Summoner's Pact can also be utilized to search for key combo pieces. The deck includes cards like Generous Ent and Hedge Maze to protect key creatures and disrupt opponents. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures. Planar Genesis can provide a big mana boost while cards like Veil of Summer and Pact of Negation help protect the combo from disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to use the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Expedition Map and Talismans, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer. The inclusion of Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and All Is Dust offers additional board control options to keep the opponent's threats at bay.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk. It also utilizes cards like Solitude and Ephemerate to control the board and protect its own creatures. The deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot by continually disrupting their plays and forcing them to react defensively, while steadily building its own board presence to secure a win.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes control elements such as removal spells like Dismember and board wipes like All Is Dust to control the board. Cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer provide additional disruption for the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Sire of Seven Deaths to close out the game once control is established.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to use a combination of aggressive creatures, burn spells, and disruption elements like Blood Moon to quickly overwhelm opponents and close out games. The deck focuses on early aggression with creatures like Ocelot Pride and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, backed up by powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The inclusion of cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Goblin Bombardment provide card advantage and additional reach. This deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and create an explosive board state to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand onto the battlefield quickly. By utilizing cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate to dig for combo pieces and protect key creatures, the deck aims to win the game through explosive plays and card advantage. Force of Negation and Thoughtseize help disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like Solitude provide removal options. A key aspect of the deck is balancing reanimation spells with card draw and control elements to create a powerful and versatile combo strategy.

The main concept of this UrzaTron Control deck is to assemble Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, and Urza's Power Plant to generate a large amount of mana quickly. With this mana, the deck aims to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny, along with versatile Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. All Is Dust provides board wipe potential, while cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Kozilek's Command offer additional value and control options.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and control effects. Cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tune the Narrative help to out-value your opponent while cards like Wrath of the Skies and Solitude deal with threats efficiently. The deck aims to control the board and card advantage, eventually winning the game through incremental advantage and powerful late-game threats like Quantum Riddler. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's game plan and ensure consistency in casting spells.

This combo deck aims to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Rider combo by using Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to tutor for the necessary pieces. The key strategy is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Disciple of Freyalise and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant, then utilize Generous Ent and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to protect the combo. Once Griselbrand is on the field, players can draw through their deck with Consign to Memory and Pact of Negation to find Planar Genesis and win the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Veil of Summer and Hedge Maze to protect against opposing strategies.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of spells and creatures to generate a win condition without relying on traditional lands. By utilizing cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Whir of Invention, the player can quickly assemble a powerful board state and overwhelm their opponent. Cards like Sink into Stupor and Suppression Ray provide control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while cards like Lotus Bloom and Tameshi, Reality Architect help generate mana for the combo pieces. The deck aims to create a powerful and efficient combo engine to win the game quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on using various counter spells and disruption cards to protect its combo pieces, specifically Goblin Charbelcher and Thundertrap Trainer. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and quickly win the game by dealing a large amount of damage to the opponent. The key strategy involves carefully managing resources and timing spells to counter threats while setting up the win condition. By utilizing efficient spells and powerful combo pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in a fast-paced manner.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures like Quantum Riddler and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Ketramose, the New Dawn. Ephemerate allows for additional value by blinking creatures like Flickerwisp and Psychic Frog for extra card advantage. The deck also has graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus and removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption and aggression, making it difficult for the opponent to execute their strategy effectively.

This UrzaTron deck focuses on assembling the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, Mine) to generate massive amounts of mana. The key strategy involves using powerful colorless spells and planeswalkers like Karn and Ugin to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes Eldrazi creatures and disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By ramping up quickly and dropping threat after threat, this deck aims to control the game and defeat the opponent with overwhelming power.

This deck focuses on assembling the Amulet of Vigor combo with Primeval Titan to quickly ramp into powerful lands and overwhelm opponents. The key strategy is to use cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore to accelerate land drops, while also utilizing cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble to manipulate the board state and generate value. The deck aims to create a strong board presence through the efficient use of lands like Urza's Saga and Gruul Turf, with additional support from cards like Crumbling Vestige and Spelunking. Ultimately, the goal is to outpace opponents and establish a dominant position through the use of unique and powerful land interactions.

This deck revolves around generating mana efficiently with rituals and card draw spells to power out a combo win condition. The key is to quickly assemble the pieces for a explosive turn using cards like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Ral, Monsoon Mage to cast a critical mass of spells in a single turn. The goal is to find and utilize Past in Flames to flashback spells from the graveyard for a lethal burst of damage with cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse supported by Wrenn's Resolve and Ruby Medallion to reduce costs.

The deck relies on a fast, all-in combo using cards like Lotus Bloom and Goblin Charbelcher to close out the game quickly. Disrupting Shoal and Spell Snare provide interaction and protection against opposing disruption. Whir of Invention allows for finding key combo pieces, while Sea Gate Restoration and Tameshi, Reality Architect provide additional card advantage. The deck contains a mix of counter spells, removal, and card draw to help control the game until the combo can be assembled and executed.
